stories.text:
A common mistake I see more and more people do is to build websites using React and Vue.js. These frameworks are meant to build web apps, they provide no advantage if you want to build a content website, worse they will kill all your SEO efforts. Having done a lot of SEO research in the past year, I came to the conclusion that search engines heavily penalize React and Vue.js websites even when they use server side rendering and I think they do this rightfully.

If I am looking for some kind of information, I want to have it right away, with spending as little bandwidth as possible and certainly I don't want to start a web app with over 1mb of javascript.

To summarize:

- Where React or Vue.js are a good choice: Web Apps that you don't want to be indexed by search engines. Such as SaaS tools or administration interfaces.

- Where you shouldn't use React or Vue.js: Content websites with little dynamic functionalities that you want to be indexed on search engines.
stories.title: React and Vue.js are meant to build web apps, not websites
